div:
@@title@@ This test characterizes the beam's general shape. It starts by sampling the image in 5 circles as shown in the following image (click for larger image):
Symmetry is calculated both axially and transversely as a percentage with:
axial = ((top - bottom) / bottom) * 100 transverse = ((right - left) / left) * 100
As an example, using the the above diagram:
axial = ((0.2349 - 0.2349) / 0.2349) * 100 = 0.0 transverse = ((0.2352 - 0.2348) / 0.2348) * 100 = 0.1704
